p: In addition to being used as the seed virus for manufacturing H5N1 vaccines, the Vero-adapted virus has the potential to become a master virus to generate high-growth reassortants for other influenz A viruses. The current egg-based technology for vaccine production is heavily relied on the high-growth PR8 master virus for generating seed viruses [12]. Therefore, it would be desirable to establish high-growth master viruses for Vero cell-based vaccine production [14], [15], [16], [17], [18], [19]. Several studies have proved the feasibility of generating reassortant vaccine viruses in Vero cells [7], [19], [20], [21]. We are using the Vero-15 virus as a master virus to generate reassortant viruses for other influenza A subtypes and evaluate their growth efficiency in Vero cells.
